cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles E of Melbourne, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast parallel to the east-central Florida coast tonight, then accelerating northeastward toward the North Carolina Outer Banks and the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: east-central Florida coast, Georgia and South Carolina coasts, North Carolina coast, and the Mid-Atlantic offshore waters
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: No Florida site listed in table – nearest listed point is Myrtle Beach SC (≈300 mi north)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (generally <39 mph) possible as the depression’s western fringe brushes the coast tonight
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; water‐level rise should remain below 1 ft along the Cape Canaveral shoreline
weather_observation.rainfall: Brief showers with total accumulations generally less than 1 inch
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents generated by the cyclone’s swell through Sunday
